channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Filthy littered rubbish, 15th January
item.description:
Ceres Road needs cleaning. As we have a problem area that is regularly being used for fly tipping I think some sort of monitored regular inspection should be done. There are warning signs now which have now been posted but are being ignored as the culprits know there are no cameras so continue to dump their rubbish.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ceres Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lads of rubbish dumped . Has been there a few days, 15th January
item.description:
Loads of rubbish including a sofa, fridge freezer has been dumped

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redcar Street, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Traffic light stuck on red at 6am, 15th January
item.description:
This is potentially a traffic light timing issue as it has happened twice now at this time (slightly before 6am) but it is stuck on red going from Central Avenue into Bellegrove Road

item.title: Big pot hole appeared, 15th January
item.description:
A big pothole seems to have appeared just right near the bend, it big enough to break people's alloy wheels or cause potential danger to a driver if they don't see it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Manorway, Northumberland Heath, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned motorbike, 15th January
item.description:
It must be around 10 months that the grey/silver HONDA SH 125 with number plate LC19YFJ was left on St Katherines Rd with a flat tyre. The motorcycle looks abandoned and it takes parking space. It is on the parking spaces in front of 23 St Katherines Rd, Erith DA18 4DS, UK

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Katherines Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Massive Fly-tipping around Asda Charlton, 14th January
item.description:
Hi there, This is ongoing issue I reported to the council several times now. I also try to contact Greenwich Shopping Park - please do something about it as this is very off-putting. Especially, given there is food supermarket next to it. Asda, the whole Greenwich Shopping Park should be ashamed of the stage at that area. Best, L

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gallions Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Could road and pavement around entrance to footpath be cleared please?, 14th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cow Path, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti Report â€“ Building / Electrical Door - -Black door on the building, above what appears to be an electrical hazard/warning sign (communal walkway), 14th January
item.description:
There are multiple graffiti signatures on and above the black door, including one clearly visible above the electrical hazard sign and another less visible black graffiti mark on the door itself. Each signature is approximately the size of a laptop. The graffiti is not offensive but negatively impacts the appearance of the communal area. This issue has been recurring since the start of the year, with new markings appearing recently. This is a shared residential walkway and the graffiti is visible to residents and visitors.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penton Place, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
